main event: An unidentified object was observed in the sky over Washington, D.C. on August 4, 1954. The object appeared to be the size of a planet and resembled a cross when observed through binoculars. It exhibited a slightly reddish-purple color and was semi-circular in shape, moving from south to northwest with a slight loss in altitude. The object was observed for approximately 1.3 hours before disappearing rapidly, with its color changing to gold as it disappeared.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a planet and resembled a cross when observed through binoculars, indicating a unique and unusual shape.
It exhibited a slightly reddish-purple color and was semi-circular in shape, which is not consistent with known aircraft or natural celestial objects.
The object was observed for approximately 1.3 hours, allowing for a prolonged and detailed observation by the witnesses.
The object's rapid disappearance and change in color to gold as it disappeared adds to the mysterious nature of the sighting.
It was reported that the object moved considerably with respect to known star clusters in the sky, indicating unusual and non-conventional movement.
